page.title: 04WILDLIFE, ST.BREWARD AREA. 3
page.content: {PHEASANT THE COMMON PHEASANT WAS INTRODUCED TO MANY PARTS OF EUROPE IN THE MIDDLE AGES THEY QUICKLY BECAME ACLIMATISED AND WAS SOON A COMMON SIGHT.THEY PREFER WOODLAND AND MARSHES WITH PLENTY OF COVER.THE EGGS ARE LAYED IN A SCRAPE IN THE GROUND.WITH 8_15 EGGS. THE EGGS ARE INCUBATED FOR 24_25 DAYS.THEIR DIET CONSISTS OF SEEDS AND BERRIES AND SUCH LIKE.THE EGGS ARE OLIVE GREEN IN COLOUR.{LENGTH {MALE:79CM FEMALE 60CM. {HEDGEHOG} THE HEDGEHOG LIVES IN OPEN DRY LAND WITH SHRUBS OR BUSHES.THEIR DIET CONSISTS OF THAT SIMILAR TO THE PHEASANT.THE YOUNG ARE BORN BLIND AND HELPLESS BUT STARTS TO VENTURE AT 3 WEEKS OLD.{LENGTH:188_200 MM.FEMALES {ARE SLIGHTLY SMALLER.
